definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: Multi-storey brick buildings, asphalt, lampposts, traffic signs.
sentences.chinese: 这里有多层砖房，沥青路，街灯，交通标志。

sentences.english: I don't know those traffic signs.
sentences.chinese: 我不了解那些交通标志。

sentences.english: A driver must be able to read traffic signs.
sentences.chinese: 驾驶员必须能辨认交通标志。

sentences.english: There's a famous traffic sign in New York.
sentences.chinese: 纽约城有一个著名的交通标志。

sentences.english: Disobeying traffic signs, signals or road markings.
sentences.chinese: 不遵守交通标志，灯号，或路面标志。

sentences.english: A motorist must be able to read traffic signs.
sentences.chinese: 驾驶员必须会辨认交通标志。

sentences.english: Please pay attention to the traffic signs when you drive next time.
sentences.chinese: 请您下次开车时注意观察交通标志。

sentences.english: In this paper, the assemblage of the traffic sign plate is presented.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了交通标志板面装配化这一概念。

sentences.english: The traffic signs indicated which way we should go.
sentences.chinese: 交通标志告诉我们该走哪条路。

sentences.english: A traffic sign should be conspicuous.
It is designed to illustrate the meanings of traffic signs.
sentences.chinese: 主要介绍各种交通标志所代表的含义。

definition: to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
pedestrian/traveler on foot/passer-by/official responsible for arranging audiences with the emperor
to go through/to pass through/to be in general use
